constraint.description: Use :focus-visible pseudo-class to show focus indicators only for keyboard navigation, not mouse clicks. This prevents visual clutter for mouse users while ensuring keyboard accessibility

constraint.description: Focus indicators must be visible in Windows High Contrast Mode using @media (forced-colors: active) with CanvasText system color (3px outline)

constraint.description: SkipLink, useFocusTrap hook must use 'use client' directive as they require browser APIs (document.getElementById, document.addEventListener, window.matchMedia)

constraint.description: Modal focus trap must cycle Tab from last to first element, Shift+Tab from first to last. Must store trigger element reference for focus restoration on close. Must handle Escape key to close modal

constraint.description: Skip link must be visually hidden (sr-only) until Tab focus, then appear at top-left with high z-index. Must use onClick to manually focus and scroll to target (not just anchor jump)
constraint.source: Epic 6 Tech Spec Section 4.1, WCAG 2.1 Success Criterion 2.4.1 Bypass Blocks

constraint.description: Main content element must have tabIndex={-1} for programmatic focus only (not in natural tab order). Must have outline-none class to hide focus ring when skip link focuses it
constraint.source: Epic 6 Tech Spec Section 4.1, accessibility best practices for skip links

constraint.description: getFocusableElements must use selector: a[href], button:not([disabled]), input:not([disabled]), select:not([disabled]), textarea:not([disabled]), [tabindex]:not([tabindex="-1"]), [contenteditable]. Must filter by isFocusable to exclude hidden/aria-hidden elements
constraint.source: Epic 6 Tech Spec Section 4.1, standard focusable elements selector

constraint.description: Focus indicators must use var(--accent-primary) which resolves to #C9A962 gold. This ensures 4.5:1 contrast ratio against --bg-primary (#0C0C0F) background
constraint.source: UX Design Specification, globals.css color tokens

constraint.description: All functions must have explicit return types, parameters must be typed, no implicit any types allowed. Use React.KeyboardEvent for keyboard event handlers

note.title: SkipLink Component Strategy
note.description: SkipLink must be a client component because it uses document.getElementById and smooth scroll. Use sr-only Tailwind utility for screen-reader-only state, then focus:not-sr-only to make it visible on keyboard focus. Position fixed at top-left with high z-index (100) to ensure it's always first focusable element and visible above all content

note.title: Focus Trap Implementation Pattern
note.description: useFocusTrap hook returns trapRef to attach to container, plus activate/deactivate functions. Activation: store trigger element, focus first element, add keydown listener. Deactivation: remove listener, restore focus. Use isActiveRef pattern to access current state in event listener (avoids stale closures). Auto-activate/deactivate based on isActive prop via useEffect

note.title: Global Focus Styles Architecture
note.description: Add focus styles to globals.css after existing media queries. Use CSS cascade order: (1) base :focus-visible for all elements, (2) :focus:not(:focus-visible) to remove for mouse, (3) specific element types (button, a, input), (4) @media (forced-colors) for high contrast. This ensures consistent behavior across all interactive elements without per-component styling

note.title: Keyboard Handler Utility Design
note.description: handleKeyboardNavigation uses switch statement on event.key for all keyboard interactions. Accepts handlers object with optional callbacks for each key. Only calls preventDefault when handler exists (avoids breaking default browser behavior for unhandled keys). This pattern standardizes keyboard handling across all components and makes it easy to add new key handlers

note.title: Focusable Element Detection
note.description: isFocusable must check: (1) element is HTMLElement, (2) not hidden or aria-hidden="true", (3) computed style display !== 'none' and visibility !== 'hidden', (4) tabindex not negative, (5) inherently focusable (a, button, input, etc.) or has explicit tabindex. This comprehensive check prevents focus trap from breaking when elements are dynamically hidden

note.title: ObituaryModal Focus Trap Integration
note.description: ObituaryModal already has triggerRef prop for focus restoration and handleClose function. Add useFocusTrap call with onEscape: handleClose, isActive: isOpen. Apply trapRef to SheetContent using ref prop. The Sheet component from shadcn/ui forwards refs properly via Radix DialogContent primitive. Focus trap will auto-activate when modal opens and deactivate when it closes

note.title: Testing Strategy for Accessibility Utils
note.description: For a11y.ts utilities, test pure functions directly: (1) handleKeyboardNavigation - verify correct handler called for each key and preventDefault behavior, (2) generateId - verify unique IDs with prefix, (3) isFocusable - test with mock DOM elements (visible button, hidden div, disabled input), (4) getFocusableElements - create container with mixed focusable/non-focusable elements and verify correct filtering

note.title: Focus Trap Hook Testing Approach
note.description: For useFocusTrap hook, test module exports and document expected behavior through code review comments (following existing test patterns from use-filters.test.ts). Test: (1) hook exports exist, (2) dependencies importable (React hooks), (3) document focus trap logic (Tab wrapping, Escape handling, focus restoration) through behavior documentation tests

note.title: SkipLink Testing Approach
note.description: For SkipLink component, test: (1) component exports and imports, (2) Tailwind sr-only utility behavior (element hidden by default), (3) focus:not-sr-only makes element visible, (4) document onClick behavior (preventDefault, getElementById, focus, scrollIntoView), (5) custom targetId and children props work correctly

note.title: High Contrast Mode Testing
note.description: Manual testing required for @media (forced-colors: active). On Windows, enable High Contrast Mode in Accessibility settings. Verify 3px CanvasText outline appears on focused elements. Note: Cannot be automated in Vitest as it requires OS-level high contrast mode

criterion.implementation: - outline-offset: 2px in :focus-visible rule - Provides breathing room between element edge and focus indicator - Improves visibility and aesthetics of focus ring
